CANVA.name: Canva
CANVA.tagline: Empowering everyone to design anything and publish anywhere with visual collaboration tools
CANVA.overview: Canva is an online graphic design platform founded in 2013 by Melanie Perkins, Cliff Obrecht, and Cameron Adams in Sydney, Australia. The platform democratizes design with drag-and-drop tools for creating presentations, social media graphics, documents, and videos. As of August 2025, Canva is valued at $65B with $3.3B ARR and 240M monthly active users. The company has been profitable for 8 consecutive years with 50%+ annual growth. AI tools are used 800M times per month (up 700% YoY). Canva acquired Affinity in 2024 for ~$380M. IPO expected in 2025-2026 with new CFO Kelly Steckelberg (ex-Zoom).

CHECKOUT.name: Checkout.com
CHECKOUT.tagline: Building enterprise payments infrastructure that makes global commerce simpler and faster
CHECKOUT.overview: Checkout.com is a global payments infrastructure company founded in 2012 by Guillaume Pousaz. The company provides payment gateway, acquiring, and processing services for enterprise clients. In September 2025, Checkout.com announced a $12B internal valuation (up 30% from $9.35B in 2023 but down from $40B peak in 2022). The company achieved profitability in 2024 with 45% net revenue growth and processes over $1B daily. Major clients include Netflix, Shein, Grab, Alibaba, Sony, and eBay.

CELONIS.tagline: Revealing and fixing inefficiencies hidden in business processes through process mining and AI
CELONIS.overview: Celonis is a process mining and execution management company founded in 2011 by Bastian Nominacher, Alexander Rinke, and Martin Klenk in Munich, Germany. The company's Process Intelligence platform analyzes business processes from enterprise systems to identify inefficiencies and drive automation. Celonis raised $400M at $13B valuation in August 2022 led by Qatar Investment Authority. ARR grew to $771M in 2023 (up 39% from $400M in 2021). Celonis ranks #12 on Forbes Cloud 100 2025 and is named a Leader in Gartner Magic Quadrant for Process Mining.

CONTENTFUL.tagline: Powering digital experiences with a composable content platform that unifies teams and content
CONTENTFUL.overview: Contentful is a headless content management system founded in 2013 by Sascha Konietzke and Paolo Negri in Berlin. The company pioneered the API-first CMS approach, enabling developers to manage and deliver content across any digital channel. Contentful raised $175M at $3B valuation in 2021 led by Tiger Global. Revenue reached $200M in 2024 with 4,000+ customers including 30% of Fortune 500 companies. In 2024, Contentful acquired Ninetailed for AI personalization capabilities.

CLICKUP.tagline: Bringing tasks, docs, goals, and chat together in one platform to replace fragmented work apps
CLICKUP.overview: ClickUp is an all-in-one productivity platform founded in 2017 by Zeb Evans and Alex Yurkowski. ClickUp raised $400M at $4B valuation in October 2021 led by Andreessen Horowitz and Tiger Global. ARR grew to $300M in 2025 with 400% growth in AI sales. In November 2025, ClickUp launched 4.0 with proactive AI agents, acquired Qatalog for enterprise AI search, and now serves 12 million users.

CALENDLY.name: Calendly
CALENDLY.tagline: Eliminating scheduling friction so professionals can focus on what matters most
CALENDLY.overview: Calendly is a scheduling automation platform founded in 2013 by Tope Awotona in Atlanta. The founder immigrated from Nigeria and funded the company by maxing out his 401k and credit cards. Calendly grew virally through its freemium model and reached $276M ARR in 2023. The company raised $350M Series B in January 2021 at $3B valuation led by OpenView Venture Partners and ICONIQ Capital. Calendly is used by over 20 million people worldwide and is present in 86% of Fortune 500 companies. CEO Tope Awotona was inducted into Georgia's Technology Hall of Fame in 2025.

C2FO.name: C2FO
C2FO.tagline: World's largest on-demand working capital platform accelerating supplier payments globally
C2FO.overview: C2FO operates the world's largest on-demand working capital platform, connecting businesses to early payment opportunities and helping them unlock cash trapped in accounts receivable. Founded in 2008 by Sandy Kemper, former CEO of UMB Financial Corporation, the company has facilitated over $400 billion in lifetime funding to businesses worldwide. In 2024, C2FO achieved a record-breaking milestone by reaching $1 billion in daily funding for the first time and processing over 42 million invoices paid an average of 32 days early. The platform serves over 200 global enterprise clients, including six Fortune 10 companies, and has expanded significantly into emerging markets with an IFC partnership and RBI approval for India's TReDS platform.

CABIFY.name: Cabify
CABIFY.tagline: Spain's first unicorn transforming sustainable urban mobility across Europe and Latin America
CABIFY.overview: Cabify is Spain's first unicorn and a leading ride-hailing platform operating across Spain and Latin America. Founded in 2011 by Juan de Antonio, the company reached unicorn status in 2018 after raising $160 million at a $1.4 billion valuation. Cabify provides multi-modal urban transportation services including ride-hailing, delivery, and corporate mobility solutions across more than 40 cities. The company has achieved three consecutive years of over 30% growth and reached break-even on EBITDA globally. With over 50 million registered users and 1.5 million driver partners, Cabify is committed to having 100% zero-emission trips by 2025 in Spain and 2030 in Latin America, positioning itself as a leader in sustainable urban mobility.

CAIS.name: CAIS
CAIS.tagline: Industry-leading platform democratizing alternative investments for financial advisors
CAIS.overview: CAIS is America's leading fintech platform for alternative investments, providing financial advisors with streamlined access to hedge funds, private equity, private credit, real estate, structured notes, and digital assets. Founded in 2009 by Matt Brown, who spent 30 years at the intersection of wealth management and technology, CAIS became a unicorn in 2022 after raising $225 million led by Apollo and Motive Partners. The platform has facilitated over $21 billion in transaction volume and supports more than 32,000 advisors. In 2025, CAIS launched an AI-powered tool that transforms hours of fund research into minutes of actionable insights, further cementing its position as the first truly open marketplace for alternative investments.

CALB.name: CALB Group
CALB.tagline: China's third-largest EV battery manufacturer powering the electric vehicle revolution
CALB.overview: China Aviation Lithium Battery (CALB) Group is a partially state-owned developer and manufacturer of lithium-ion batteries, ranking as China's third-largest and the world's fourth-largest EV battery supplier by installed capacity. Founded in 2007 as part of China Airborne Missile Academy (AVIC) and currently controlled by Changzhou city government, CALB became the first battery manufacturer listed on the Hong Kong Stock Exchange in October 2022, raising $1.3 billion. In 2024, the company achieved 36.49 GWh of power battery installations in China, up 11% year-over-year, and expects net income to double to approximately RMB 786-874 million. CALB supplies batteries to major automakers and is aggressively expanding capacity with a goal to reach 1 TWh annual production by 2030.

CALM.name: Calm
CALM.tagline: World's leading app for sleep, meditation, and relaxation with millions of subscribers
CALM.overview: Calm is the leading app for sleep, meditation, and relaxation, with over 130 million downloads and 4.5 million paid subscribers. Founded by Alex Tew and Michael Acton Smith, the company achieved unicorn status in 2020 after raising $75 million at a $2 billion valuation led by Lightspeed Venture Partners with participation from TPG, Goldman Sachs, and Marc Benioff. Under CEO David Ko's leadership, Calm reached profitability in 2024 and became the highest-grossing healthcare app in the world. The company expanded into clinical mental health with Calm Health, a B2B solution for payers, providers, and employers. Apple named Calm one of its Top 24 Apps of 2024, cementing its position as the global leader in digital wellness.

CAMBRICON-TECHNOLOGIES.name: Cambricon Technologies
CAMBRICON-TECHNOLOGIES.tagline: China's leading AI chip company dubbed the Chinese Nvidia powering domestic AI infrastructure
CAMBRICON-TECHNOLOGIES.overview: Cambricon Technologies is China's leading AI chip designer, often called 'China's Nvidia' for its focus on AI accelerators and GPGPUs. The partially state-owned company was China's top-performing stock of 2024, surging 383% to reach a $41 billion market cap - outpacing even Nvidia and TSMC in percentage gains. Listed on the Shanghai STAR Market in 2020, Cambricon achieved its first quarterly profit in Q4 2024, projecting 70% revenue growth to 1.2 billion yuan. The company's 7-nanometer AI chips have positioned it as China's domestic answer to US chip restrictions, benefiting from government pressure on Chinese companies to adopt local alternatives to Nvidia processors. In 2024, Cambricon's stock breached the 1,000 yuan mark, a psychological threshold matched only by Kweichow Moutai in A-share history.

CAMBRIDGE-MOBILE-TELEMATICS.name: Cambridge Mobile Telematics
CAMBRIDGE-MOBILE-TELEMATICS.tagline: World's largest telematics service provider making roads and drivers safer with AI
CAMBRIDGE-MOBILE-TELEMATICS.overview: Cambridge Mobile Telematics (CMT) is the world's largest telematics service provider, measuring and protecting over 55 million drivers globally through AI-powered mobile technology. Founded in 2010 by two MIT professors, the company pioneered behavior-based insurance (BBI) and reached unicorn status with a $500 million SoftBank-led investment. CMT's DriveWell Fusion platform gathers sensor data from smartphones, connected vehicles, dashcams, and IoT devices to detect distracted driving, crashes, and risky behaviors. The company's 2024 Road Risk Report revealed an 8.6% decline in distracted driving - the largest drop in five years - helping prevent an estimated 55,000 crashes and $2.2 billion in economic damages annually. CMT earned Frost & Sullivan's 2024 Market Leadership Award for innovations in telematics insurance and connected claims.

CANSEMI.name: CanSemi Technology
CANSEMI.tagline: Guangdong's first 12-inch wafer fab driving China's analog semiconductor self-sufficiency
CANSEMI.overview: CanSemi Technology (Guangzhou CanSemi) operates Guangdong Province's first 12-inch wafer fabrication facility, a strategic asset in China's push for semiconductor self-sufficiency. Founded in 2017 and backed by major automotive OEMs including GAC, SAIC, and BAIC, the company specializes in analog ICs for automotive, industrial, and 5G applications. In December 2024, CanSemi launched production at its CNY 16.25 billion Phase III facility, adding 40,000 wafers per month and bringing total capacity to 80,000 12-inch wafers monthly. The fab utilizes 180-90nm technology with six ASML lithography machines, producing power devices, PMICs, MCUs, and image sensors. With over CNY 37 billion invested across three phases and plans for a fourth phase, CanSemi is establishing Guangzhou as a major semiconductor manufacturing hub.

CAPITOLIS.name: Capitolis
CAPITOLIS.tagline: Israeli fintech unicorn transforming capital markets with resource optimization technology
CAPITOLIS.overview: Capitolis is a pioneering fintech platform that drives financial resource optimization for capital markets. Founded in 2017 by Gil Mandelzis, Tom Glocer, and Igor Teleshevsky, the Israeli startup reached unicorn status in 2022 with a $1.6 billion valuation after raising $110 million in Series D funding. The company's SaaS platform has eliminated trillions of dollars in overall positions for more than 100 financial institutions, including many of the world's largest global and regional banks. In 2024, Citi, Morgan Stanley, State Street, and UBS each invested $5 million and joined the board, validating Capitolis's position as critical capital markets infrastructure. Recognized by CNBC, Euromoney, and Fast Company, the company continues to expand its network and launch new products to optimize how the capital markets operate.

CAPSULE.name: Capsule
CAPSULE.tagline: NYC-based digital pharmacy unicorn reimagining the prescription experience
CAPSULE.overview: Capsule is a New York City-based digital pharmacy that achieved unicorn status in 2021 with a $1 billion valuation after raising $300 million in Series D funding led by Durable Capital Partners. Founded in 2015 by Eric Kinariwala, Capsule has reimagined the pharmacy experience with same-day prescription delivery, seamless refills, and integrated healthcare services. The company partners with doctors, hospitals, and insurance providers to streamline prescription management and improve medication adherence. Capsule's platform handles everything from coordinating with prescribers to managing insurance claims, delivering medications directly to patients' doors. Backed by major investors including Thrive Capital, TCV, T. Rowe Price, and Baillie Gifford, Capsule continues to expand its one-stop-shop digital health ecosystem.

CARBON.name: Carbon
CARBON.tagline: Digital Light Synthesis 3D printing technology powering production-grade additive manufacturing
CARBON.overview: Carbon is a Silicon Valley-based 3D printing unicorn that pioneered Digital Light Synthesis (DLS) technology, revolutionizing additive manufacturing beyond prototyping into production-grade applications. Founded in 2013 by Dr. Joseph DeSimone and team, the company combines molecular science with hardware and software to create industrial 3D printers capable of producing end-use parts at scale. Carbon's breakthrough partnership with Adidas produced the first mass-manufactured 3D printed midsoles in the Futurecraft 4D and subsequent 4DFWD lines. The platform serves industries including footwear, automotive, dental, and consumer products with a subscription-based business model.

CARBON-HEALTH.tagline: Tech-enabled healthcare combining urgent care, primary care, and virtual visits in one platform
CARBON-HEALTH.overview: Carbon Health is a San Francisco-based healthcare unicorn combining urgent care, primary care, and virtual care through a tech-enabled platform. Founded in 2015 by Udemy co-founder Eren Bali and physicians Caesar Djavaherian and Tom Berry, the company operates a hybrid model with physical clinics and telehealth services. Carbon Health expanded rapidly during COVID-19, reaching a $3.3B peak valuation before restructuring as pandemic revenue declined. The company partners with CVS Health to pilot offerings in select stores and has served millions of patients across its clinic network.

CARDEKHO.name: CarDekho
CARDEKHO.tagline: India's leading auto platform connecting buyers and sellers of new and used vehicles
CARDEKHO.overview: CarDekho is India's largest automotive digital platform and Rajasthan's first unicorn startup, founded in Jaipur in 2008 by brothers Amit and Anurag Jain. The company operates a comprehensive ecosystem covering new car research, used car transactions, auto insurance, and auto financing. CarDekho Group includes BikeDekho (two-wheelers), InsuranceDekho (insurance distribution), OTO (Indonesia), and Zigwheels (Southeast Asia). CEO Amit Jain is known as a Shark Tank India judge. The company is planning an IPO on Indian exchanges valued at approximately $2-2.5 billion.

CARGOX.name: CargoX
CARGOX.tagline: Brazil's largest digital freight marketplace connecting shippers with 1.4 million trucks
CARGOX.overview: CargoX (operating as Frete.com) is Brazil's leading digital freight marketplace, often called 'Uber for Trucking.' Founded in 2013 by Federico Vega, the São Paulo-based unicorn connects over 10,000 shippers with 1.4 million trucks, intermediating more than $18 billion in annual transactions. The platform uses real-time data and AI to optimize routes, reduce empty miles, and improve trucking efficiency across Latin America. Major clients include Heineken, Unilever, Nestlé, and Whirlpool. CargoX reached unicorn status in 2021 with backing from SoftBank, Tencent, Goldman Sachs, and Blackstone.

CARIBOU.name: Caribou
CARIBOU.tagline: Auto fintech helping consumers refinance car loans and save on monthly payments
CARIBOU.overview: Caribou (formerly MotoRefi) is a Denver-based auto fintech unicorn helping consumers refinance car loans to save money on monthly payments. Founded in 2016 by Kevin Bennett, the platform connects car owners with credit unions and community banks offering better interest rates. Caribou helps customers save an average of $100+ per month by simplifying the auto refinancing process. The company reached unicorn status in 2022 after raising $115M Series C led by Goldman Sachs. CEO Simon Goodall (ex-Groupon) took over leadership in September 2023 to expand the auto-loan refinance market presence.

CAROUSELL.name: Carousell
CAROUSELL.tagline: Southeast Asia's leading consumer-to-consumer marketplace for secondhand goods
CAROUSELL.overview: Carousell is Singapore's leading consumer-to-consumer marketplace app and Southeast Asia's largest classifieds platform. Founded in 2012 by NUS alumni Quek Siu Rui, Marcus Tan, Lucas Ngoo, and Cheng Han Ngoo, the platform enables users to buy and sell secondhand items across categories including electronics, fashion, vehicles, and property. Carousell operates in eight markets including Singapore, Hong Kong, Taiwan, Malaysia, Indonesia, Philippines, Australia, and Canada. The company reached unicorn status in 2021 with $1.1B valuation and is focused on profitability with 2024 revenue of $119M and narrowing losses.

CARRO.tagline: Southeast Asia's largest automotive marketplace with integrated financing and insurance
CARRO.overview: Carro is Southeast Asia's largest automotive marketplace and Singapore's leading unicorn in the used car space. Founded in 2015 by CMU alumni Aaron Tan, Aditya Lesmana, and Kelvin Chng, the platform offers end-to-end car buying and selling with integrated financing, insurance, and after-sales services. Carro operates in Singapore, Malaysia, Thailand, Taiwan, Indonesia, Japan, and Hong Kong. The company achieved first operating profit in 2024 with 11x YoY EBITDA growth. Backed by SoftBank Vision Fund, Temasek, and EDBI, Carro is preparing for a US IPO targeting $3B+ valuation in 2026.

CARS24.tagline: India's leading used car marketplace with international presence across UAE, Thailand, and Australia
CARS24.overview: CARS24 is one of India's largest used car marketplaces and one of the four major organized players in India's used car segment. Founded in 2015 in Gurgaon by IIT Bombay alumni Vikram Chopra (CEO), Mehul Agrawal, Gajendra Jangid, and Ruchit Agarwal, the platform enables consumers to buy and sell pre-owned vehicles. CARS24 has raised over $1.3 billion from investors including SoftBank, Alpha Wave Global, and DST Global, achieving a $3.2B valuation. The company expanded internationally to UAE, Thailand, and Australia in 2021. Recent restructuring efforts focus on core business profitability.

CARSOME.name: Carsome
CARSOME.tagline: Malaysia's first tech unicorn and Southeast Asia's largest integrated car platform
CARSOME.overview: Carsome is Malaysia's first tech unicorn and Southeast Asia's largest integrated used car platform by revenue and transaction volume. Founded in 2015 by Eric Cheng and Jiun Ee Teoh, the platform enables consumers to buy and sell used cars across Malaysia, Indonesia, Thailand, Singapore, and the Philippines. Carsome reached unicorn status in 2021 and raised $290M Series E in 2022 at $1.7B valuation. The company achieved its first quarterly profit in Q2 2024 with over $310M revenue and is preparing for a dual listing on Singapore and US exchanges.

CARSON-GROUP.name: Carson Group
CARSON-GROUP.tagline: Leading independent wealth management and financial technology firm serving advisors and families
CARSON-GROUP.overview: Carson Group is one of America's largest independent wealth management firms, founded in 1983 by Ron Carson in Omaha, Nebraska. The company operates three core businesses: Carson Wealth (wealth management), Carson Coaching (advisor coaching and consulting), and Carson Partners (RIA network with 110+ partner offices). Bain Capital acquired a 29% stake in 2021, valuing the firm at over $1 billion. The company serves 50,000+ families with $35.5 billion in assets under management. In 2024, founder Ron Carson stepped down as CEO, with Burt White assuming the role while Carson remains Chairman.

CARTA.name: Carta
CARTA.tagline: The end-to-end platform connecting private capital to drive growth and ownership for everyone
CARTA.overview: Carta is the leading equity management platform helping private companies, venture capital firms, and their stakeholders manage cap tables, 409A valuations, fund administration, and liquidity. Founded in 2012 by Henry Ward as eShares, the company serves over 50,000 startups and 1.6 million security holders, managing more than $4 trillion in equity. Carta powers cap tables for 35% of all venture-backed startups and 84% of U.S. unicorns. After raising $1.16 billion including a $500 million Series G in 2021 at a $7.4 billion valuation, Carta has become the essential infrastructure for private market ownership.

CARTCOM.name: Cart.com
CARTCOM.tagline: Unified commerce and logistics platform giving brands the infrastructure of the world's largest retailers
CARTCOM.overview: Cart.com is a leading unified commerce and logistics platform that provides brands with the software, infrastructure, and expertise of the world's largest online retailers. Founded in 2020 and headquartered in Houston, Texas, the company has grown rapidly through nine strategic acquisitions including OceanX (Guthy-Renker's fulfillment arm) and Amify. Cart.com operates 18 omnichannel fulfillment centers totaling over 10 million square feet, with more than half being temperature-controlled. Serving 6,000+ customers and processing 75 million orders annually, Cart.com reached unicorn status with a $1.6 billion valuation in 2025.

CASTELION.name: Castelion
CASTELION.tagline: Building mass-producible hypersonic weapons to restore American deterrence
CASTELION.overview: Castelion is a defense technology company founded by former SpaceX executives to build America's first mass-producible hypersonic strike weapons. Headquartered in El Segundo, California, the company is developing Blackbeard, the first U.S. hypersonic system engineered from inception for industrial-rate output and commercial unit cost. In 2025, Castelion conducted more than 20 development flight tests and secured contracts from the U.S. Army and Navy for platform integration. The company is building Project Ranger, a 1,000-acre solid rocket motor manufacturing facility in New Mexico capable of producing thousands of Blackbeard missiles per year. Castelion raised $450 million including a $350 million Series B in December 2025.

CASTORE.name: Castore
CASTORE.tagline: Better Never Stops - premium sportswear engineered for elite performance
CASTORE.overview: Castore is a British premium sportswear brand founded in 2015 by brothers Tom and Phil Beahon. The company develops high-performance athletic apparel using patented fabrics and advanced technical engineering, with partnerships including McLaren F1, Newcastle United, Rangers FC, Everton FC, and England Cricket. Tennis champion Andy Murray is both a shareholder and brand ambassador through the AMC collaboration. Castore reached a £950 million valuation in 2023 after raising £145 million from investors including Raine Group, Felix Capital, and Hanco Ventures. Headquartered in Manchester, the company has expanded globally with retail stores and secured the exclusive European licensing rights for Umbro in 2024.

CATL-INTELLIGENT.name: CATL Intelligent Mining
CATL-INTELLIGENT.tagline: Powering the intelligent transformation of mining through advanced battery technology and autonomous systems
CATL-INTELLIGENT.overview: CATL Intelligent Mining is the smart mining solutions division of Contemporary Amperex Technology Co. Limited (CATL), the world's largest EV battery manufacturer. Through strategic partnerships including EACON Mining Technology, CATL provides battery systems optimized for extreme mining conditions, enabling electric autonomous haulage trucks to operate in high altitudes, freezing temperatures, and rugged terrains. As of September 2025, over 2,000 electric autonomous mining trucks powered by CATL technology have covered 65 million kilometers across coal, copper, limestone, and gold mining operations. CATL has also partnered with BHP to explore electrification solutions for global mining operations.

CATO-NETWORKS.tagline: Pioneering SASE to deliver secure, cloud-native networking to every enterprise
CATO-NETWORKS.overview: Cato Networks is the pioneer of SASE (Secure Access Service Edge), delivering a single cloud-native platform that converges SD-WAN, a global private backbone, and complete network security. Founded in 2015 by cybersecurity legends Shlomo Kramer (co-founder of Check Point and Imperva) and Gur Shatz, Cato enables enterprises to securely connect any user, site, cloud, or application anywhere in the world. The company is considered a leading IPO candidate in cybersecurity.

CEDAR.overview: Cedar is the leading patient payment and financial engagement platform for hospitals, health systems, and medical groups. Founded in 2016 by Florian Otto and Arel Lidow, Cedar combines data science and design to create personalized, consumer-friendly billing experiences that improve patient satisfaction and provider collections. CELESTIA.name: Celestia
CELESTIA.tagline: The first modular data availability network that enables anyone to easily deploy their own blockchain
CELESTIA.overview: Celestia is the first modular blockchain network, pioneering a new paradigm where consensus is decoupled from execution through data availability sampling. Originally founded in 2019 as LazyLedger by Mustafa Al-Bassam, Ismail Khoffi, and John Adler, Celestia enables developers to deploy custom blockchains with minimal overhead using its pluggable data availability layer. The network launched its mainnet beta on October 31, 2023, alongside the TIA token. Celestia raised $155 million total, including a $100 million round in September 2024 led by Syncracy Capital. The Matcha upgrade in 2025 significantly boosted network capacity and improved token economics.

CELESTIAL-AI.name: Celestial AI
CELESTIAL-AI.tagline: Revolutionizing AI infrastructure with Photonic Fabric interconnect technology
CELESTIAL-AI.overview: Celestial AI is a photonic semiconductor company revolutionizing AI infrastructure with its Photonic Fabric platform that enables unprecedented memory bandwidth by separating compute and memory using optical interconnects. Founded by David Lazovsky and headquartered in Santa Clara, California, the company's technology delivers faster AI processing with significantly better energy efficiency than traditional copper-based solutions. Celestial AI raised $520 million including a $255 million Series C1 at a $2.5 billion valuation in 2025. The Global Semiconductor Alliance named Celestial AI its 2024 'Start-Up to Watch.' In December 2025, Marvell announced its acquisition of Celestial AI for $3.25 billion to $5.5 billion, depending on revenue milestones.

CERA.name: Cera
CERA.tagline: UK's leading AI-driven home healthcare provider saving the NHS billions
CERA.overview: Cera is the UK's leading digital-first home healthcare provider, founded in 2016 by Dr Ben Maruthappu MBE and Marek Sacha. The company uses AI to match carers and nurses with patients, optimize care schedules, and predict health deteriorations before they require hospitalization. Cera has delivered nearly 100 million patient home visits and saved the NHS over £1 billion. The company became EBITDA-positive in 2023 and free-cashflow positive in 2024, with annual revenue of £225 million. Named the UK's #1 HealthTech, Cera raised $150 million in January 2025 to expand its AI platform globally, bringing total funding to over $571 million.

CEREBRAL.name: Cerebral
CEREBRAL.tagline: Online mental health services providing therapy and psychiatry care to improve access to treatment
CEREBRAL.overview: Cerebral is a telehealth company providing online mental health services including therapy, counseling, and medication management. Founded in 2020 by Kyle Robertson and Ho Anh, the company grew rapidly during the pandemic and reached a $4.8 billion valuation with a $300 million Series C from SoftBank Vision Fund 2 in December 2021. However, Cerebral faced significant regulatory challenges including a $3.6 million DOJ settlement over controlled substance prescribing practices and a $7.1 million FTC penalty for data privacy violations in 2024. Under new leadership with Brian Reinken as interim CEO, the company continues to serve patients while implementing enhanced clinical quality and compliance measures.

CEREBRAS-SYSTEMS.name: Cerebras Systems
CEREBRAS-SYSTEMS.tagline: Building the world's largest and fastest AI chips to accelerate machine learning and deep learning workloads
CEREBRAS-SYSTEMS.overview: Cerebras Systems is pioneering the future of AI computing with the world's largest and fastest AI chips. The company's Wafer-Scale Engine (WSE) technology uses an entire silicon wafer to create a single massive chip with 900,000 AI-optimized cores and 4 trillion transistors, making it 56 times larger than the biggest GPU. Cerebras serves leading research institutions, government agencies, and enterprises including AWS, Meta, and IBM, enabling breakthrough AI research and production deployments. The WSE-3 was named TIME's Best Invention of 2024 in the AI category.

CERTIK.overview: CertiK is the world's largest blockchain security company, founded by professors from Columbia and Yale University. Using formal verification technology originally developed for mission-critical systems, CertiK provides comprehensive security audits for smart contracts, blockchain protocols, and decentralized applications. CHAINALYSIS.tagline: The blockchain data platform powering investigations, compliance, and market intelligence across cryptocurrency
CHAINALYSIS.overview: Chainalysis is the blockchain data platform, providing data, software, services, and research to government agencies, exchanges, financial institutions, and insurance and cybersecurity companies in over 70 countries. The company's data powers investigation, compliance, and market intelligence software that has been used to solve some of the world's most high-profile criminal cases and grow consumer access to cryptocurrency safely. CHAINGUARD.name: Chainguard
CHAINGUARD.tagline: Making open-source software trustworthy by default with hardened container images and supply chain security
CHAINGUARD.overview: Chainguard is the safe source for open-source software, helping organizations build, deploy, and run applications with minimized risk from vulnerabilities and supply chain attacks. The company provides hardened base container images, language libraries, and virtual machine formats that are verified for security and updated continuously. Chainguard's approach dramatically reduces Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVEs) in container images, helping enterprises meet compliance requirements while accelerating development velocity. Founded by former Google engineers who created key open-source security projects like Sigstore, Chainguard serves over 150 major customers including ANZ Bank, Canva, GitLab, Hewlett Packard Enterprise, Snap Inc., and Wiz.

CHALK.name: Chalk
CHALK.tagline: The data platform for AI inference powering real-time feature engineering and machine learning operations
CHALK.overview: Chalk is the data platform for AI inference that enables machine learning teams to write features in pure Python and automatically translates them into high-performance C++ and Rust pipelines for real-time data delivery. The platform eliminates complex ETL processes and unifies structured and unstructured data with native vector storage, automated evaluations, and seamless integrations with major LLM providers. Founded by a team that built Google Wallet and Stripe's in-store payment infrastructure, Chalk powers core lending and fraud models for leading fintech companies. The platform has been recognized in the AI 100 (2024) and serves customers including Ramp, MoneyLion, Vital, and Doppel.

CHANGXIN-MEMORY-TECHNOLOGIES.overview: ChangXin Memory Technologies (CXMT) is China's largest DRAM integrated device manufacturer, headquartered in Hefei, Anhui province. With capital expenditure of $6-7 billion in 2023-2024 and plans to mass-produce HBM3 chips by 2026, CXMT is positioning itself to challenge global leaders Samsung, SK Hynix, and Micron.

CHIPPER-CASH.overview: Chipper Cash is Africa's leading cross-border mobile payment platform, enabling free instant P2P money transfers across seven African countries: Ghana, Uganda, Nigeria, Tanzania, Rwanda, South Africa, and Kenya. Founded in 2018 by Ham Serunjogi and Maijid Moujaled, the company has grown to over 7 million users processing approximately 100,000 transactions daily. Chipper has expanded beyond payments to offer Chipper Cards (virtual and physical debit), Chipper Checkout (business payment gateway), and Chipper Stocks (fractional share trading). The company achieved unicorn status in 2021 at a $2B valuation, now valued at $1.25B making it Africa's fifth most valuable fintech.

Founded in 2018, the company achieved unicorn status in 2022 with a $1.2 billion valuation after raising $310 million in total funding. Choco's platform digitizes the traditionally phone-and-fax-based ordering process, using AI-driven order management to reduce food waste, optimize inventory, and create a more sustainable food system. The platform connects over 3,000 professional dealers and 30,000 private sellers listing more than 500,000 watches, attracting 20 million watch enthusiasts monthly from over 120 countries. The company became the first billion-dollar technology disruptor in the watch industry in 2021, backed by LVMH CEO Bernard Arnault's Aglaé Ventures and General Atlantic. CITYBLOCK-HEALTH.overview: Cityblock Health is a tech-driven healthcare provider transforming care delivery for underserved Medicaid and Medicare populations through value-based care. Founded in 2017 by Toyin Ajayi, Bay Gross, and Iyah Romm (spun out of Sidewalk Labs), Cityblock provides integrated primary care, behavioral health, and social services across seven states. CLIMEWORKS.overview: Climeworks is the world's leading direct air capture (DAC) company, removing carbon dioxide directly from the atmosphere and storing it permanently underground. Founded in Switzerland in 2009, Climeworks has raised over $1 billion in funding, making it the highest-funded pure-play carbon removal firm globally. The company operates the world's largest DAC facility, Mammoth, in Iceland, capable of capturing 36,000 tons of CO2 annually. CLOUDWALK.overview: CloudWalk is a global payment network built on modern technology and proprietary blockchain, focused on revolutionizing the payment ecosystem for small and medium-sized enterprises. Founded in 2013, CloudWalk provides digital banking, loans, cashback cards, online sales, digital wallets, and payment terminals to over 1 million customers across 5,500+ Brazilian cities. The company achieved profitability in 2023 with $320.5 million in revenue and $22.3 million in profits. In 2024, CloudWalk scaled to $562 million in annualized revenue with nearly $1 million in revenue per employee, making it one of the world's most efficient fintechs. CLUBHOUSE.overview: Clubhouse is an audio-based social networking app that pioneered the drop-in voice conversation format, enabling users to join live audio rooms on topics ranging from technology and business to music and politics. Founded in 2020 by Paul Davison and Rohan Seth, Clubhouse became a pandemic-era phenomenon, growing from zero to 100 million users in less than a year and reaching a $4 billion valuation. Backed by Andreessen Horowitz, DST Global, and Tiger Global, the platform raised $310 million in funding. While facing increased competition from Twitter Spaces, LinkedIn Audio, and Spotify's live audio features, Clubhouse continues to serve communities seeking authentic voice-based connections.

COALITION.overview: Coalition is one of the largest cyber insurance and security providers in the United States and Canada, combining active risk management with comprehensive insurance coverage. Founded in 2017 by Joshua Motta and John Hering, Coalition uses technology to help businesses prevent, prepare for, and respond to cyber incidents. The company reached a $5 billion valuation after raising $800 million in funding and protects over 85,000 organizations with its Active Insurance approach. COCKROACH-LABS.overview: Cockroach Labs is the company behind CockroachDB, a distributed SQL database built for cloud-native applications that demand resilience, massive scale, and data locality. Founded in 2015 by former Google engineers Spencer Kimball, Peter Mattis, and Ben Darnell, Cockroach Labs has raised over $633 million and achieved a $5 billion valuation. CockroachDB provides strong consistency guarantees, automatic sharding, and multi-region deployment capabilities that enable businesses to build globally distributed applications. The database is used by companies requiring high availability and regulatory compliance across multiple data centers and cloud providers.

CODA.overview: Coda is an all-in-one collaborative workspace that combines the functionality of documents, spreadsheets, and applications into a single platform. Founded in 2014 by Shishir Mehrotra and Alex DeNeui from Google and YouTube, Coda achieved a $1.4 billion valuation and was used by companies including Uber, Spotify, The New York Times, and DoorDash. In December 2024, Coda was acquired by Grammarly to combine Coda's collaborative document capabilities with Grammarly's AI-powered writing assistance. At the time of acquisition, Coda had $41 million in revenue and over 10,000 paying customers.

COGNITE.overview: Cognite is a global industrial software company headquartered in Oslo, Norway, founded in 2016 by John Markus Lervik and Geir Engdahl. The company's flagship product, Cognite Data Fusion (CDF), is an industrial DataOps platform that contextualizes and connects operational data from various sources, making it accessible to humans and AI systems alike. Cognite serves major industrial companies including Shell, Equinor, Aker BP, and Saudi Aramco, helping them unlock value from their operational technology data. Listed on the Oslo Stock Exchange, Cognite was recognized as a Leader in Industrial Data Management by Verdantix in 2025, with SaaS ARR approaching $100M.

COGNITION.overview: Cognition is an applied AI company founded in 2023 by Scott Wu, Steven Hao, and Walden Yan, building the world's first fully autonomous AI software engineer. Their flagship product, Devin, can handle complete software engineering tasks from understanding requirements through implementation and deployment. Devin can write code, debug issues, deploy applications, and collaborate with human engineers on complex projects. In 2025, Cognition acquired Windsurf (formerly Codeium) to expand its AI coding product suite. The company serves category-defining enterprise customers including Goldman Sachs, Citi, Dell, Cisco, Palantir, Ramp, Nubank, and Mercado Libre, achieving explosive growth from $1M ARR in September 2024 to $73M by June 2025.

COHERE.overview: Cohere is a Canadian artificial intelligence company founded in 2019 by former Google Brain researchers, including Aidan Gomez, co-author of the transformative "Attention Is All You Need" paper. The company specializes in developing enterprise-focused large language models and AI platforms that prioritize data security and privacy. Unlike consumer-facing competitors, Cohere focuses exclusively on B2B solutions, offering cloud-agnostic, customizable AI that can be deployed on-premises or in private clouds. As of September 2025, Cohere has achieved a $7 billion valuation and serves hundreds of enterprise clients including Oracle, RBC, McKinsey, and government agencies worldwide.

COHESITY.overview: Cohesity is the world's largest data protection software provider following its December 2024 acquisition of Veritas' enterprise data protection business. Founded in 2013 by Mohit Aron (who also founded Nutanix), Cohesity consolidates backup, disaster recovery, and file services into a unified platform powered by AI. The company's DataProtect and DataHawk solutions help organizations secure and manage their data across multi-cloud environments. With the Veritas combination, Cohesity now serves over 12,000 customers including 86 of the Fortune 100, reaching $1.5B ARR in just 11 years - the fastest in the data protection industry. CoinDCX has grown to serve more than 20.4 million users with over $165B in annualized transaction volume and $1.2B in assets under custody. COLOR.overview: Color Health is a healthcare technology company transforming cancer care through population-scale genetic testing, virtual cancer clinics, and AI-powered care navigation. Founded in 2013, the company pivoted from genetic testing during COVID-19 to become a leader in COVID testing and vaccine coordination, then evolved into a comprehensive cancer screening and early detection platform. Color's virtual clinic assesses cancer risk, increases screening accessibility, and accelerates diagnosis for employers and health plans. The company reached a $4.6B valuation in 2021 and has since partnered with OpenAI (for cancer copilot AI) and Google Cloud (for breast cancer screening expansion). Color serves large employers and government programs with end-to-end cancer care solutions.

COLOSSAL-BIOSCIENCES.name: Colossal Biosciences
COLOSSAL-BIOSCIENCES.tagline: World's first de-extinction company using CRISPR gene-editing to revive extinct species including woolly mammoths and Tasmanian tigers
COLOSSAL-BIOSCIENCES.overview: Colossal Biosciences is the world's first de-extinction company, founded in 2021 by entrepreneur Ben Lamm and Harvard geneticist George Church. The company is using CRISPR gene-editing technology to bring back extinct species including the woolly mammoth (target: 2028), Tasmanian tiger (thylacine), and dodo bird. In January 2025, Colossal raised $200M at a $10.2B valuation, becoming Texas' first decacorn. The company has over 170 scientists across facilities in Dallas, Boston, and Melbourne, and has spun out two companies: Form Bio ($30M for computational biology) and Breaking ($10.5M for plastic degradation). Colossal's technologies have applications beyond de-extinction including artificial wombs, species preservation, and human healthcare.

COMMERCEIQ.name: CommerceIQ
COMMERCEIQ.tagline: AI-powered retail ecommerce management platform helping brands optimize sales, profitability, and share across Amazon and major retailers
COMMERCEIQ.overview: CommerceIQ is an AI-powered retail ecommerce management platform founded in 2012 by Guru Hariharan and Himanshu Jain. The platform helps consumer brands optimize their sales, market share, and profitability across Amazon, Walmart, Target, Instacart, and other major retailers. CommerceIQ uses machine learning to automate retail operations including advertising, supply chain, promotions, and content management. In 2022, the company raised $115M from SoftBank Vision Fund 2 at a $1B valuation, becoming a unicorn. With 2024 revenue reaching $137M and over 2,200 customers, CommerceIQ serves major CPG brands. In November 2024, the company launched Nexis, the first integrated AI teammate for omnichannel commerce.

COMMERCETOOLS.name: commercetools
COMMERCETOOLS.tagline: Pioneer of headless commerce enabling enterprises to build flexible, composable digital commerce experiences through API-first architecture
COMMERCETOOLS.overview: commercetools is the pioneer of headless commerce, founded in Germany and now headquartered in Munich. The company provides an API-first, cloud-native commerce platform that enables enterprises to build flexible, composable digital commerce experiences. commercetools pioneered the MACH architecture (Microservices, API-first, Cloud-native, Headless) that has become the industry standard for modern commerce. The company serves major global brands and has been named a Leader in the Gartner Magic Quadrant for Digital Commerce five years in a row. With $175M in 2024 revenue and a $1.9B valuation, commercetools is on track for an IPO in 2025-2026. In February 2025, the company underwent layoffs as the e-commerce market normalized from pandemic-era growth rates.

COMMONWEALTH-FUSION-SYSTEMS.name: Commonwealth Fusion Systems
COMMONWEALTH-FUSION-SYSTEMS.tagline: Leading fusion energy company developing SPARC compact tokamak to deliver clean, limitless energy through commercially viable nuclear fusion
COMMONWEALTH-FUSION-SYSTEMS.overview: Commonwealth Fusion Systems (CFS) is the world's leading private fusion energy company, spun out of MIT in 2018. CFS is developing SPARC, a compact tokamak designed to demonstrate net energy gain (Q>1) by 2027, and ARC, the world's first grid-scale commercial fusion power plant planned for Virginia in the early 2030s. The company has raised nearly $3 billion - about one-third of all private fusion investment globally - from investors including Google, NVIDIA, and Breakthrough Energy Ventures. In 2025, CFS signed landmark power purchase agreements with Google (200 MW) and Eni ($1B), and received $15M from the DOE Milestone-Based Fusion Development Program. CFS's high-temperature superconducting magnet technology has proven commercially viable, putting them on track to deliver fusion energy this decade.

COMMURE.name: Commure
COMMURE.tagline: Healthcare operating system powering health systems with AI-driven automation, clinical workflows, and revenue cycle management
COMMURE.overview: Commure is a healthcare operating system company that merged with Athelas in October 2023 to create a $6B healthcare infrastructure platform serving over 130 health systems. The company's CommureOS platform unifies clinical AI, workflow automation, revenue cycle management, and patient engagement tools. Commure has made strategic acquisitions including Augmedix ($139M, 2024) for AI medical documentation and Memora Health for digital care navigation. Backed by General Catalyst, Sequoia, and leading healthcare investors, Commure is building the definitive operating layer for healthcare organizations.

CONSENSYS.name: ConsenSys
CONSENSYS.tagline: Building the infrastructure for Web3 through MetaMask, Infura, and Linea as the leading Ethereum developer platform
CONSENSYS.overview: ConsenSys is the leading Web3 software company building foundational infrastructure for the decentralized internet, including MetaMask (the world's most popular self-custodial crypto wallet with 30M+ monthly active users), Infura (API platform powering thousands of dApps), and Linea (zkEVM Layer 2 rollup). The company is reportedly preparing for an IPO with JPMorgan and Goldman Sachs as advisors and continues to expand MetaMask with perpetual trading, rewards programs, and the upcoming MASK token.

CONSTELLATION-AUTOMOTIVE-GROUP.name: Constellation Automotive Group
CONSTELLATION-AUTOMOTIVE-GROUP.tagline: Leading UK automotive marketplace operating cinch, BCA, and WeBuyAnyCar across the used vehicle value chain
CONSTELLATION-AUTOMOTIVE-GROUP.overview: Constellation Automotive Group is the UK's largest automotive marketplace, operating three market-leading brands: BCA (Europe's largest used vehicle auction), cinch (online used car retail platform), and WeBuyAnyCar (instant car buying service). Formerly BCA Marketplace on the FTSE 250, the company was taken private by TDR Capital in 2019 and raised £1.4B+ in 2021 from sovereign wealth funds including ADIA and GIC, plus Neuberger Berman and Soros Fund Management. The group acquired assets from Cazoo following its 2024 collapse and continues to dominate the UK used car ecosystem.

CONTRAST-SECURITY.name: Contrast Security
CONTRAST-SECURITY.tagline: Runtime application security platform protecting code from development to production with RASP and IAST technology
CONTRAST-SECURITY.overview: Contrast Security is a pioneer in runtime application security, providing the only platform that combines Interactive Application Security Testing (IAST), Runtime Application Self-Protection (RASP), and Software Composition Analysis (SCA) in a unified solution. The company's code security platform enables organizations to find and fix vulnerabilities in their applications during development and protect them in production. Founded in 2014 by Jeff Williams (OWASP co-founder), Contrast became a unicorn in 2021 with $150M Series E funding led by Liberty Strategic Capital (Steven Mnuchin's fund). The platform serves enterprise customers seeking to shift security left while maintaining runtime protection.

Copado reached unicorn status in 2021 with $140M Series C funding led by Insight Partners, with strategic backing from Salesforce Ventures, SoftBank Vision Fund 2, and IBM Ventures. COPPER.name: Copper
COPPER.tagline: Institutional-grade digital asset custody and prime services for the largest crypto trading firms
COPPER.overview: Copper is a leading institutional digital asset infrastructure provider, offering secure custody, trading, and prime services to hedge funds, asset managers, and financial institutions. The company's award-winning MPC (multi-party computation) custody solution eliminates single points of failure with distributed key shards, while ClearLoop enables off-exchange trading without moving assets. Backed by Tiger Global, Barclays, and Dawn Capital with $791M in funding at a $2B valuation, Copper serves clients including Brevan Howard Digital ($25B+ AUM) and 21Shares (world's largest crypto ETP issuer). The company is pursuing US licensing including BitLicense as it expands blockchain-based collateral management into traditional finance.

CORNAMI.name: Cornami
CORNAMI.tagline: Revolutionary computing architecture enabling real-time Fully Homomorphic Encryption with 1,000,000x acceleration over traditional processors
CORNAMI.overview: Cornami (derived from 'tsunami of cores') is pioneering a breakthrough computing architecture that enables real-time Fully Homomorphic Encryption (FHE), allowing computation on encrypted data without decryption. The company's FracTLcore Computing Fabric scales from thousands to millions of cores, achieving 1,000,000x acceleration over conventional processors from NVIDIA and Intel. Backed by SoftBank Vision Fund 2 with $210M in funding, Cornami's technology addresses the trillion-dollar opportunity in data privacy, enabling secure AI, blockchain, and privacy-preserving machine learning workloads. The platform represents a fundamental breakthrough for quantum-resistant security.

COSM.overview: Cosm is revolutionizing sports and entertainment viewing through immersive 360-degree LED dome venues that transport fans to the action. CREATIO.tagline: No-code platform enabling enterprises to automate workflows and CRM with composable AI-powered applications
CREATIO.overview: Creatio is a global vendor of one platform to automate industry workflows and CRM with no-code and AI-native technology. Founded in 2014, the company has become the sixth Ukrainian-founded unicorn, joining GitLab, Grammarly, People.ai, Unstoppable Domains, and airSlate. Creatio's platform enables enterprises to build and customize applications without coding, accelerating digital transformation across sales, marketing, and service operations. The platform is recognized as the only leader in Forrester Wave: Low-Code Platforms for Citizen Developers Q1 2024. Headquartered in Boston with an R&D center in Kyiv, Creatio serves thousands of customers across 100 countries including Colgate-Palmolive, AMD, MetLife, OKI, and Saudi Telecom Company.

CRED.name: CRED
CRED.tagline: Members-only rewards platform empowering creditworthy Indians with exclusive benefits for responsible financial behavior
CRED.overview: CRED is an Indian fintech unicorn founded in 2018 by Kunal Shah, creator of Freecharge which sold to Axis Bank. The members-only platform rewards creditworthy Indians for paying credit card bills on time, requiring a credit score of 750+ for membership. CRED has expanded beyond bill payments to offer CRED Pay (merchant payments), CRED Cash (short-term credit lines), CRED Mint (investments), CRED Travel, and CRED Garage (premium commerce). The platform serves over 35% of India's credit card users, processing billions in transactions monthly. Known for viral Super Bowl-style advertisements featuring Bollywood legends, CRED has built India's most premium fintech brand targeting the country's top 1% of credit users.

CREDITAS.name: Creditas
CREDITAS.tagline: Brazilian fintech platform transforming secured lending with asset-backed consumer loans at lower interest rates
CREDITAS.overview: Creditas is one of Latin America's largest fintech platforms, founded in 2012 by Spanish entrepreneur Sergio Furio in São Paulo, Brazil. The company pioneered asset-backed consumer lending in Brazil, using homes and automobiles as collateral to offer loans at significantly lower interest rates than traditional unsecured credit. Creditas operates a fully digital platform integrating credit scoring, loan origination, and asset valuation. The company has expanded into auto financing, home equity loans, payroll loans for employees, and a marketplace for selling cars and real estate. Having weathered the 2022-23 tech downturn with significant restructuring, Creditas is now targeting profitability while growing its R$5+ billion credit portfolio.

CRESTA.name: Cresta
CRESTA.tagline: Real-time AI platform transforming contact centers by coaching agents and automating customer interactions at scale
CRESTA.overview: Cresta is a contact center AI company founded in 2017 by Stanford AI Lab dropouts Zayd Enam and Tim Shi, along with renowned AI pioneer Sebastian Thrun. The company builds generative AI solutions that help enterprises improve agent performance and automate customer interactions in real-time. Cresta's platform analyzes millions of conversations to identify best practices, coach agents live during calls, and surface insights for managers. Major customers include CarMax, Blue Nile, Intuit, Cox, and Holiday Inn. The company has nearly quadrupled its ARR and doubled its customer base in two years, earning a spot on the Forbes AI 50 List of 2024.

CREXI.name: Crexi
CREXI.tagline: Commercial real estate marketplace accelerating deal cycles with AI-powered insights and comprehensive property data
CREXI.overview: Crexi is a leading commercial real estate technology platform founded in 2015, transforming how CRE professionals market, analyze, and transact properties. The platform combines a comprehensive property marketplace with AI-powered analytics, providing brokers, investors, and tenants with tools to accelerate deal cycles. With millions of monthly users, Crexi has facilitated over $615 billion in closed transactions and marketed more than $7 trillion in property value over nine years. The platform offers listing syndication, market intelligence, property research, and transaction management capabilities that streamline the entire commercial real estate workflow.

CRIBL.name: Cribl
CRIBL.tagline: Data engine for IT and security enabling enterprises to route, process, and analyze observability data at scale
CRIBL.overview: Cribl is the data engine for IT and security, founded in 2018 by former Splunk employees including CEO Clint Sharp. The company pioneered the observability pipeline category, enabling enterprises to route, reduce, and enrich machine data before sending it to any destination. Cribl became the fourth-fastest infrastructure company to reach $100M ARR (centaur status) in under four years, with 163% ARR CAGR over four years. A quarter of Fortune 500 companies are Cribl customers, using its platform to unlock value from observability data while reducing costs. The company's vendor-neutral approach allows enterprises to break free from data lock-in and optimize their security and IT operations data infrastructure.

CROSS-RIVER-BANK.name: Cross River Bank
CROSS-RIVER-BANK.tagline: Banking-as-a-service platform enabling fintechs to embed payments, lending, and banking products through API infrastructure
CROSS-RIVER-BANK.overview: Cross River Bank is a technology-driven FDIC-member bank founded in 2008 by Gilles Gade, pioneering the banking-as-a-service model that enables fintech companies to offer regulated financial products without their own bank charter. The Cross River Operating System (COS) is an API-driven banking platform allowing partners like Affirm, Coinbase, Stripe, and Checkout.com to embed payments, lending, and banking services into their applications. Cross River maintains over 80 fintech partnerships and has processed billions in transactions. Despite regulatory scrutiny from the FDIC regarding third-party partnerships, the bank remains a cornerstone infrastructure provider for the embedded finance ecosystem.

CRUISE.name: Cruise
CRUISE.tagline: GM's autonomous vehicle division pivoting from robotaxi operations to personal vehicle self-driving technology
CRUISE.overview: Cruise is General Motors' autonomous vehicle subsidiary, acquired in 2016 for $1 billion with ambitions to build a profitable robotaxi fleet. At its peak, Cruise achieved a $30 billion valuation with investments from Microsoft, Honda, and institutional investors. However, after accumulating over $10 billion in operating losses and a critical 2023 incident where a pedestrian was dragged by a Cruise vehicle in San Francisco, GM announced in December 2024 it would exit the robotaxi business entirely. The company lost its California operating permits, laid off 900 employees, and cancelled its custom Origin robotaxi vehicle. GM is now integrating Cruise's technology into its personal vehicle ADAS (Advanced Driver Assistance Systems) development, expecting to save $1 billion annually.

CRUSOE-ENERGY-SYSTEMS.name: Crusoe Energy
CRUSOE-ENERGY-SYSTEMS.tagline: Energy-first AI infrastructure company powering data centers with stranded natural gas to reduce emissions
CRUSOE-ENERGY-SYSTEMS.overview: Crusoe Energy is an energy-first AI infrastructure company founded in 2018, pioneering Digital Flare Mitigation technology that converts stranded natural gas into power for data centers. By capturing gas that would otherwise be flared or vented, Crusoe reduces methane emissions while providing clean computing infrastructure. The company operates 86 mobile data centers across 30 sites in U.S. oil fields plus Argentina, processing over 10 million cubic feet of gas daily. Crusoe's Abilene, Texas facility is a 998,000 sq ft data center developed through a $3.4B joint venture capable of housing 100,000 GPUs with 1.2GW capacity. Key customers include Sony, Databricks, Together AI, and Luma AI, with the company participating in OpenAI's $500B Stargate project.

CRUX.name: Crux Climate
CRUX.tagline: Capital markets platform enabling efficient transfer and monetization of clean energy tax credits at scale
CRUX.overview: Crux Climate is a capital markets platform for the clean economy, founded in 2023 by Alfred Johnson (former Deputy Chief of Staff at US Treasury) and Allen Kramer. The platform facilitates the transfer and monetization of clean energy tax credits created by the Inflation Reduction Act, fundamentally transforming how decarbonization projects are financed in the United States. Crux estimates $30 billion of tax credit transfers occurred in 2024, with projections of $55-60 billion for 2025. The marketplace connects clean energy developers with corporate buyers seeking to purchase transferable tax credits, creating liquidity and price transparency in this emerging market.

CULTFIT.name: Cult.fit
CULTFIT.tagline: India's leading fitness unicorn offering gyms, group workouts, mental health, and nutrition services through integrated digital platform
CULTFIT.overview: Cult.fit is India's first fitness unicorn, founded in 2016 by Mukesh Bansal (Myntra founder) and Ankit Nagori. The company operates an integrated health and fitness platform encompassing cult.fit (gyms and group workouts), mind.fit (mental health), eat.fit (nutrition), and care.fit (primary healthcare). With nearly 500 gyms across India and a digital platform offering live and on-demand workout classes, Cult.fit has built India's largest fitness ecosystem. The company achieved unicorn status in 2021 with Zomato's investment and is now preparing for a ₹2,500 crore IPO. Revenue tripled to ₹694 crore in FY23, growing to over ₹1,000 crore in FY24.

CULTURE-AMP.name: Culture Amp
CULTURE-AMP.tagline: Employee experience platform helping companies build high-performing cultures through engagement, performance, and development tools
CULTURE-AMP.overview: Culture Amp is the world's leading employee experience platform, founded in 2009 in Melbourne by Didier Elzinga, Jon Williams, Douglas English, and Rod Hamilton. The platform helps organizations understand and improve employee engagement, performance, and retention through AI-powered surveys, analytics, and action tools. Culture Amp serves over 6,500 companies globally including Salesforce, Slack, Lyft, and Airbnb. The company achieved unicorn status in 2021 with a $1.5B valuation and continues to expand through strategic acquisitions including Orgnostic in 2024. A Forrester Total Economic Impact study found enterprise customers achieved 311% ROI with the platform.

CURRENT.name: Current
CURRENT.tagline: Modern banking platform transforming financial access for everyday Americans with fee-free accounts and credit-building tools
CURRENT.overview: Current is a consumer fintech company providing mobile banking services to underserved Americans through its partner banks, Choice Financial Group and Cross River Bank. Founded in 2015 by Stuart Sopp and Trevor Marshall, the company offers fee-free spending accounts, early paycheck access, overdraft protection, the Build Card for credit building, savings pods with up to 4% interest, and fee-free ATM access. With over 4 million accounts and no physical branches, Current delivers banking entirely through its mobile app, targeting Americans struggling with access to affordable liquidity and credit.

CYBERHAVEN.name: Cyberhaven
CYBERHAVEN.tagline: Data Detection and Response platform using data lineage technology to protect enterprise intellectual property from insider threats
CYBERHAVEN.overview: Cyberhaven is a data security company that created Data Detection and Response (DDR), an innovative platform that protects enterprise intellectual property using pioneering data lineage technology. Unlike traditional DLP tools, Cyberhaven traces data from its origin through every movement, transformation, and fragmentation, providing context to accurately classify and protect sensitive data like source code, product designs, and customer records. The platform uses Linea AI with Large Lineage Models (LLiM) for autonomous risk detection, reducing false positives by 95% and Mean Time to Respond by 80%. The company serves enterprises globally from San Jose, California.

CYERA.name: Cyera
CYERA.tagline: AI-powered data security platform providing instant visibility and protection across cloud, SaaS, and on-premises environments
CYERA.overview: Cyera is a data security company that has become one of the fastest-growing cybersecurity unicorns, tripling its valuation multiple times in 2024. Founded in 2021 by Yotam Segev and Tamar Bar-Ilan, the company provides the foundation for Data Security Posture Management (DSPM), offering agentless discovery, classification, assessment, and protection of structured and unstructured data across clouds, SaaS, data lakes, and on-premises environments. Cyera takes the guesswork out of cloud data security by delivering instant Data Reality to organizations. With offices in New York and Tel Aviv, the company serves enterprise customers globally and is on track to reach $100M ARR.
